results.title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
results.creator_credit: David Goldie and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: ‘Out of Sight, Out of Mind’, in its depiction of prison conditions, helped to raise awareness about a much neglected section of our society. It provided extensive insight into the prison system, interviewing prisoners, prison officers and administrators. There are four parts titled ‘Locked Up’, ‘Surviving in the Nick’, ‘The Keepers and the Kept’, and ‘The Cycle of Crime’. This program pulls no punches, describes the conditions of various correctional institutions around Australia and also offers some suggestions for improvements.

results.title: This is the army
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Hal B. Wallis, Jack L. Warner, Thirtieth Cemalux, Hollywood House Video and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In World War I dancer Jerry Jones stages an all-soldier show on Broadway, called Yip Yip Yaphank. Wounded in the War, he becomes a producer. In World War II his son Johnny Jones, previously his father’s assistant, gets the order to stage a new all-soldier show, called “This is the army”. But in his personal life he has problems, because he refuses to marry his fiance until the war is over. Cast includes George Murphy, Joan Leslie, George Tobias, Alan Hale, Kate Smith, and men from the armed forces including Ronald Reagan and Joe Louis. Based on the play by Irving Berlin, music and lyrics by Irving Berlin. Includes bonus blooper footage of Ronald Reagan in rehearsal. Note: “Copyright Thirtieth Cemalux Pty Ltd 1986”

results.title: Hollywood or bust
results.creator_credit: Frank Tashlin, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Hollywood or bust marked the last collaboration between Jerry Lewis and Dean Martin and the second time the pair were directed by Frank Tashlin (who directed numerous Jerry Lewis comedies). When Steve Wiley (Dean Martin) rigs a car raffle in order to pay off the bookies that he is deeply indebted to, he also lands a partnership with Malcolm Smith (Jerry Lewis), the real winner of the prize. With a new car, Malcolm decides to head to Hollywood in order to meet the starlet he is besotted with, Anita Ekberg (playing herself); Steve decides to join him and hopefully win some dough in the Las Vegas casinos to pay the henchmen after him. The two head cross-country with Malcolm’s great dane in tow; they also lend a ride to Terry (Pat Crowley), a pretty singer for whom Wiley falls. This musical comedy and road movie contains much of the usual slapstick that was Lewis’ signature schtick; it also plays up to Martin’s image as the smooth and charming lady-killer. Reportedly the shoot was not a fun one with Lewis being a difficult and rambunctious presence on set.

results.title: I Was a male war bride
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Sol Siegel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Classic Howard Hawks’ comedy sees Cary Grant play Captain Henri Rochard, a French officer who falls for an American army official staioned in Europe. Following the chaos however, and bureaucratic red-tape that marked the cessations of hostilities in World War 2, the pair find it almost impossible to make their union legal. Circumstances force Rochard to pose an a ‘war bride’ in order to secure happiness, which of course leads to no end of strife and embarrassment for the eager groom.

results.title: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
results.creator_credit: John Sturges, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Considered to be one of the best western films ever made, director John Sturges explores the relationship between two of the west’s most celebrated legends - Wyatt Earp (Burt Lancaster) and Doc Holliday (Kirk Douglas). Earp is a U.S. Marshal in Dodge City and Holliday a dentist - turned gambler - who knows how to handle a gun. When Earp saves Holliday from mob violence, the foes become friends and join forces to rid the west of the lawless Clanton gang. It all leads up to the legendary Gunfight at the O.K. Corral. Screenplay by Leon Uris. Featuring a small appearance by a very young Dennis Hopper.

results.title: Blue Hawaii (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Hal B. Wallis and Hal Wallis Productions
results.brief_description: Chad Gates (Elvis Presley) returns to Hawaii after leaving the army. On his return he rebels against his rich and domineering mother (Angela Lansbury) and leaves the family pineapple business for a job as a tourist guide. Chad’s tours lead him straight into a tropical squall of trouble with his mother, the law and his girlfriend. Stars: Elvis Presley, Joan Blackman and Angela Lansbury.

results.title: The Perils of Pauline
results.creator_credit: George Marshall, Sol Siegel and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Fabricated biography of silent serial queen, Pearl White. A frantic re-creation of old time Hollywood, with plenty of slapstick chases. Stars Betty Hutton, Billy De Wolfe, William Demarest, Constance Collier and Frank Faylen. Based on the story by P.J. Wolfson, with credit to Charles W. Goddard who wrote the original serial.
